attributes.action: Get on with it: Deal, No Deal, or Remain. An informed vote to end the deadlock
attributes.additional_details: The people should therefore be asked whether they want the deal that has been negotiated (as it has been made clear that no alternative deal will be made available), no deal, or the revocation of article 50 to remain in the EU. Leading to this, parliament should release a document which states the risks and benefits of each scenario and should be accountable for any misinformation. One televised debate should be held with a representative from each option. No further campaigning should occur.
attributes.background: The results of the recent local elections clearly demonstrated that the government's current Brexit strategy is not the will of the people. It's clear that people are disgruntled by the time spent on this project resulting in a lack of time spent on important issues, what they want regarding Brexit.
